trans-unit.source: Step 6: Test the Solution
trans-unit.target: Step 6: Test the Solution

trans-unit.source: In this topic, you go through the procedures to test the solution.
trans-unit.target: In this topic, you go through the procedures to test the solution.

trans-unit.source: This solution has two scenarios to be tested:
trans-unit.target: This solution has two scenarios to be tested:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>The success scenario</embeddedLabel> where the message is routed from the EDI receive pipeline to the intermediary <token>xml_bridge</token>, hosted at <codeInline>https://<legacyItalic>%%amp;lt;mybiztalkservicename%%amp;gt;</legacyItalic>.biztalk.windows.net/default/B2BConnector</codeInline>, which finally routes the message to an on-premise SAP Server via a relay endpoint hosted on <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>The success scenario</embeddedLabel> where the message is routed from the EDI receive pipeline to the intermediary <token>xml_bridge</token>, hosted at <codeInline>https://<legacyItalic>%%amp;lt;mybiztalkservicename%%amp;gt;</legacyItalic>.biztalk.windows.net/default/B2BConnector</codeInline>, which finally routes the message to an on-premise SAP Server via a relay endpoint hosted on <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: To test this scenario, you drop a valid X12 850 PO message to the FTP location and then use the SAP GUI to see if the ORDERS05 IDOC is received in SAP.
trans-unit.target: To test this scenario, you drop a valid X12 850 PO message to the FTP location and then use the SAP GUI to see if the ORDERS05 IDOC is received in SAP.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>The failure scenario</embeddedLabel> where the message is routed to <codeInline>https://<legacyItalic>%%amp;lt;servicebus_namespace%%amp;gt;</legacyItalic>.servicebus.windows.net/Suspend</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>The failure scenario</embeddedLabel> where the message is routed to <codeInline>https://<legacyItalic>%%amp;lt;servicebus_namespace%%amp;gt;</legacyItalic>.servicebus.windows.net/Suspend</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: To test this scenario, we’ll drop an invalid X12 850 PO message (so that it fails), and gets routed to failure endpoint.
trans-unit.target: To test this scenario, we’ll drop an invalid X12 850 PO message (so that it fails), and gets routed to failure endpoint.

trans-unit.source: We use a relay receiver service that captures any message that hits the failure endpoint and writes the error message to an XML file.
trans-unit.target: We use a relay receiver service that captures any message that hits the failure endpoint and writes the error message to an XML file.

trans-unit.source: To test the success scenario
trans-unit.target: To test the success scenario

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the location where you downloaded and extracted <embeddedLabel>SAPIntegration.zip</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the location where you downloaded and extracted <embeddedLabel>SAPIntegration.zip</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: From the <embeddedLabel>InputMessages</embeddedLabel> folder, copy <embeddedLabel>Success_SampleMessage.edi</embeddedLabel> and drop it to the FTP location you specified in the EDI agreement.
trans-unit.target: From the <embeddedLabel>InputMessages</embeddedLabel> folder, copy <embeddedLabel>Success_SampleMessage.edi</embeddedLabel> and drop it to the FTP location you specified in the EDI agreement.

trans-unit.source: Wait for the file to disappear.
trans-unit.target: Wait for the file to disappear.

trans-unit.source: Using the SAP GUI, logon to the SAP Server you are targeting for this scenario.
trans-unit.target: Using the SAP GUI, logon to the SAP Server you are targeting for this scenario.

trans-unit.source: On the home screen, enter <userInput>WE02</userInput> in the text box and press <userInput>ENTER</userInput>:
trans-unit.target: On the home screen, enter <userInput>WE02</userInput> in the text box and press <userInput>ENTER</userInput>:

trans-unit.source: On the IDOC List page, press <userInput>F8</userInput> to retrieve a list of IDOCs received.
trans-unit.target: On the IDOC List page, press <userInput>F8</userInput> to retrieve a list of IDOCs received.

trans-unit.source: You must see an entry for the most recent IDOC received, as shown in the following screenshot:
trans-unit.target: You must see an entry for the most recent IDOC received, as shown in the following screenshot:

trans-unit.source: To test the failure scenario
trans-unit.target: To test the failure scenario

trans-unit.source: Download the <embeddedLabel>MessageReceiver</embeddedLabel> tool from <externalLink><linkText>Azure BizTalk Services Samples</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=303933</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Download the <embeddedLabel>MessageReceiver</embeddedLabel> tool from <externalLink><linkText>Azure BizTalk Services Samples</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=303933</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Build the project and use the resulting command line executable to receive messages at a <token>sb2</token> endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Build the project and use the resulting command line executable to receive messages at a <token>sb2</token> endpoint.

trans-unit.source: This tool accepts command line parameter, and the sequence and usage of those parameters are:
trans-unit.target: This tool accepts command line parameter, and the sequence and usage of those parameters are:

trans-unit.source: Where:::
trans-unit.target: Where:::

trans-unit.source: Parameter name
trans-unit.target: Parameter name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> Namespace
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> Namespace

trans-unit.source: The <token>sb2</token> namespace
trans-unit.target: The <token>sb2</token> namespace

trans-unit.source: IssuerName
trans-unit.target: IssuerName

trans-unit.source: Issuer Name for the <token>sb2</token> namespace
trans-unit.target: Issuer Name for the <token>sb2</token> namespace

trans-unit.source: IssuerKey
trans-unit.target: IssuerKey

trans-unit.source: Issuer Key for the <token>sb2</token> namespace
trans-unit.target: Issuer Key for the <token>sb2</token> namespace

trans-unit.source: RelativeAddress
trans-unit.target: RelativeAddress

trans-unit.source: Relative address of the relay endpoint where suspended messages are routed.
trans-unit.target: Relative address of the relay endpoint where suspended messages are routed.

trans-unit.source: You get this address under the <embeddedLabel>Message Suspension Settings</embeddedLabel> section of the <embeddedLabel>Route</embeddedLabel> page on the <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> tab for the agreement you created in <link xlink:href="370548fe-3443-4ae5-ba83-a29faad46b94" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create and Deploy the EDI Receive Pipeline</link>.
trans-unit.target: You get this address under the <embeddedLabel>Message Suspension Settings</embeddedLabel> section of the <embeddedLabel>Route</embeddedLabel> page on the <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> tab for the agreement you created in <link xlink:href="370548fe-3443-4ae5-ba83-a29faad46b94" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create and Deploy the EDI Receive Pipeline</link>.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, you configured the agreement to send suspended messages to <codeInline>http://<legacyItalic>%%amp;lt;servicebus_namespace%%amp;gt;</legacyItalic>.servicebus.windows.net/Suspend</codeInline>, so you must set this parameter to <userInput>Suspend</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, you configured the agreement to send suspended messages to <codeInline>http://<legacyItalic>%%amp;lt;servicebus_namespace%%amp;gt;</legacyItalic>.servicebus.windows.net/Suspend</codeInline>, so you must set this parameter to <userInput>Suspend</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Mode
trans-unit.target: Mode

trans-unit.source: Indicate whether the entity is a Queue, one-way relay, or a two-way relay.
trans-unit.target: Indicate whether the entity is a Queue, one-way relay, or a two-way relay.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, because we chose to receive the messages to a one-way relay, you must set this to <userInput>OneWayRelay</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, because we chose to receive the messages to a one-way relay, you must set this to <userInput>OneWayRelay</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, to test the EDI solution, open a command prompt, navigate to the solution where you built the MessageReceiver project, and run the following command:
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, to test the EDI solution, open a command prompt, navigate to the solution where you built the MessageReceiver project, and run the following command:

trans-unit.source: This starts the relay service where the suspended messages get routed to.
trans-unit.target: This starts the relay service where the suspended messages get routed to.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the location where you downloaded and extracted <embeddedLabel>SAPIntegration.zip</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the location where you downloaded and extracted <embeddedLabel>SAPIntegration.zip</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: From the <embeddedLabel>InputMessages</embeddedLabel> folder, copy <embeddedLabel>Failure_SampleMessage.edi</embeddedLabel> and drop it to the FTP location you specified in the EDI agreement.
trans-unit.target: From the <embeddedLabel>InputMessages</embeddedLabel> folder, copy <embeddedLabel>Failure_SampleMessage.edi</embeddedLabel> and drop it to the FTP location you specified in the EDI agreement.

trans-unit.source: Wait for the file to disappear.
trans-unit.target: Wait for the file to disappear.

trans-unit.source: Switch back to the <embeddedLabel>MessageReceiver</embeddedLabel> console window.
trans-unit.target: Switch back to the <embeddedLabel>MessageReceiver</embeddedLabel> console window.

trans-unit.source: This console application shows the message received at the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: This console application shows the message received at the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The message is also saved under the \bin\Debug folder of the <embeddedLabel>MessageReceiver</embeddedLabel> project.
trans-unit.target: The message is also saved under the \bin\Debug folder of the <embeddedLabel>MessageReceiver</embeddedLabel> project.
